summary: A speaker advises against lazy parenting, suggesting parents focus on positive affirmations and gratitude journals for their children instead of screens. The speaker emphasizes building systems that help children learn and build a muscle of gratitude and appreciation, noting that external factors can clog children's filters and are not the priority.
transcript: Stop being a lazy parent. Lazy parenting is not a mindset. They're focusing on all the things. Oh, I'll give you a toy, I'll give you an iPad. Oh, I'll put on cartoons. That's why your kids are messed up. Take all that off the table, focus on positive affirmations. Focus on positive thinking. Have them work on gratitude journals. Build systems in your home where your children start to learn and build the muscle of gratitude and appreciation. Watch things shift. We're clogging our children's filters with all the external things, not priority on the thing.
